<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LOGISTICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/17/fedex-profit-falls-40-fiscal-q2-cuts-guidance?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Wake FedEx Up When December Ends
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="FedEx truck in Christmas lights " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1576624195.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="FedEx truck in Christmas lights " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1576624195.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Christmas is exactly one week away.<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What you’re thinking: </strong></span><span>“I should really start buying presents.”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What FedEx is thinking:</strong></span><span> “Oh no, they’re going to start buying presents.” </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">FedEx is very busy this time of year, but not too busy to report fiscal Q2 earnings that <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/17/fedex-fdx-earnings-q2-fy-2020.html?__source=twitter%7Cmain&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">missed expectations</a> on both the top and bottom lines. Profit fell 40% and the company lowered its earnings guidance for the year...again. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To confront this “period of challenges and changes,” FedEx is going to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/fedex-warns-of-another-hit-to-profits-11576618506?mod=breakingnews&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">restrict hiring</a> and shrink some of its air operations. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">This holiday season has been tough for the industry</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In addition to battling slower economic growth, delivery companies have to deal with...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">A late Thanksgiving:</strong></span><span> This year has six fewer holiday shopping days than 2018, but you still have the same amount of relatives. Delivery companies must handle </span><span><a href="https://www.retaildive.com/news/package-deal-what-holiday-delivery-can-tell-us-about-the-future-of-retail/568852/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">almost double</a></span><span> their average package volume within a shorter timeframe. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Bad weather: </strong></span><span>Winter storms in the Upper Midwest, Rockies, and the Northeast </span><span><a href="https://www.wtol.com/article/news/local/holiday-delivery-deadlines/512-5c3bda91-f6e4-4bd9-8ad3-5ed9548270d1?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">caused delays</a></span><span>, UPS said.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Then there’s Amazon</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Monday, Amazon said it was blocking its third-party sellers from using FedEx’s ground delivery service for Prime shipments, citing bad performance. FedEx will be in timeout “until the delivery performance of these ship methods improves,” an Amazon email <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/amazon-blocks-sellers-from-using-fedex-ground-for-prime-shipments-11576525190?mod=hp_lead_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reviewed by the WSJ</a> said. <strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Fast facts: </strong></span><span>In 2018, independent third-party sellers accounted for 58% of merchandise sales on Amazon—</span><span><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1018724/000119312519103013/d727605dex991.htm?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">up from 34%</a></span><span> in 2010.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">FedEx downplayed the news, <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/amazon-blocks-sellers-from-using-fedex-ground-for-prime-shipments-2019-12-16-15103614?siteid=rss&rss=1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">saying</a> “the overall impact to our business is minuscule.” Minuscule in impact, perhaps, but heavy in symbolism. In August, FedEx <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/08/07/fedex-to-end-ground-delivery-contract-with-amazon.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ended</a> its ground delivery contract with Amazon as Bezos was expanding his own delivery empire. The two companies are now competing head-to-head in the logistics arena.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Last week, Morgan Stanley </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/12/analyst-amazon-delivering-nearly-half-its-packages-instead-of-ups-fedex.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">estimated</a></span><span> that Amazon was already delivering roughly 50% of its own packages in the U.S.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And it’ll soon pass UPS and FedEx in total volume. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>FedEx shares fell nearly 7% after it reported earnings yesterday. Investors are worried.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TAX
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/17/industries-spared-spending-bill?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
House Sends Senate 2,300-Page Christmas Card
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Capitol Hill " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="http://c1.peakpx.com/wallpaper/141/800/991/capitol-washington-dome-congress-wallpaper-preview.jpg">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Peakpx</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Deep inside the $1.4 trillion <a href="https://apnews.com/05565ff1986720c70c66c9dd9e23310d?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spending deal</a> passed by the U.S. House yesterday was an <a href="https://www.jct.gov/publications.html?func=startdown&id=5237&mod=article_inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">amendment</a> detailing which industries scored extensions on their federal tax breaks. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Who’s celebrating early </h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">In the niche category:</strong></span><span> mine rescue teams, racehorse owners, and motorsport arenas.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">In the probably-more-relevant-to-you category:</strong></span><span> energy-efficient buildings, some wind energy producers, biofuel producers, craft distillers, and some smaller brewers. Without the extension, most adult beverage producers would have faced a </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/17/business/economy/craft-distilling-liquor-tax-extension.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">400% bump</a></span><span> in taxes come New Year’s Day. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Who’s not </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Companies working on other clean energy tech, like <a href="https://www.cnet.com/roadshow/news/tesla-gm-federal-electric-car-tax-credit-extension/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">electric vehicles</a>, solar, and batteries. Democrats are hoping they can <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-16/deal-on-biodiesel-and-beer-credits-hinges-on-broader-tax-package?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">negotiate</a> additional renewables tax breaks in exchange for tweaks related to building renovations in Trump's 2017 tax cuts. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The impact</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The <a href="https://www.healthcaredive.com/news/aca-taxes-repealed-in-year-end-spending-bill-draft-surprise-billing-not-in/569239/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">repeal</a> of three Obamacare taxes is expected to cut $373 billion from federal revenue through the 2020s. The “<a href="https://www.taxpolicycenter.org/briefing-book/what-are-tax-extenders?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tax extenders</a>” (temporary tax provisions) should shave off another $54 billion. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>we probably won’t need a holiday miracle for the Senate and White House to sign off on the spending bill to avert a government shutdown before Friday’s deadline.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REAL ESTATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/17/nycs-57th-street-ranked-expensive-world?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
This View Doesn't Come Cheap
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="View of Central Park " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2NjA5ODE2LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Image by <a href="https://pixabay.com/users/dariasophia-9082096/?utm_source=link-attribution&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=image&utm_content=3425664" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dariasophia</a> from <a href="https://pixabay.com/?utm_source=link-attribution&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=image&utm_content=3425664" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Pixabay</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’ve ever wandered down 57th Street in Manhattan and thought, “Gosh...I could never afford to live here,” you’d be correct. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s the street with the <a href="https://nypost.com/2019/12/16/the-most-expensive-street-in-the-world-is-in-midtown-manhattan/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most expensive properties in the world</a>, according to a new study from broker Knight Frank. Since 2015, 41 homes have been sold on 57th Street for more than $25 million, including hedge fund manager Bill Ackman’s <a href="https://www.6sqft.com/bill-ackman-thinks-he-can-flip-one57-penthouse-for-500m/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">purchase</a> of a $91.5 million penthouse at One57.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>57th Street is sometimes called Billionaires’ Row. It’s home to those skinny, King Kong-proof skyscrapers that are increasingly defining the Midtown skyline. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But there might not be enough billionaires to fill these condos. Developers are “turning to an array of concessions to lure buyers for the backlog of high-priced inventory that’s built up in recent years,” </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-17/new-york-billionaires-row-ranked-world-s-top-luxury-street?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bloomberg reports</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Honorable mentions: </strong>Hong Kong’s Mount Nicholson Road, NYC’s Park Ave., and London’s Grosvenor Square were all in the top five.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY THE ASCENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
We Already Know the Best Credit Cards of 2020
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And we’re not telling you what they are. Wait, hold on, that’s <em>exactly</em> what we’re doing.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This <a href="https://www.fool.com/the-ascent/credit-cards/landing/morning-brew-best-card/?utm_site=theascent&utm_campaign=ta-cc-co-mb-discb-1218prim-5-na-na&utm_medium=cpc&utm_source=mb" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">list of credit cards</a> that The Ascent is about to put out into the world is so special, so incredible, that it’s taken all of their considerable power to contain it on one <a href="https://www.fool.com/the-ascent/credit-cards/landing/morning-brew-best-card/?utm_site=theascent&utm_campaign=ta-cc-co-mb-discb-1218prim-5-na-na&utm_medium=cpc&utm_source=mb" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">simple page</a> for you to quickly and easily peruse.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You want <strong style="color:#000">to avoid interest for 18 months</strong>? It’s on the list. You <strong style="color:#000">want to up your travel points game</strong>? It’s on the list. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Basically, whatever would make you think, “Wow, that’s a really great credit card” is on this list.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">And we’re sharing the top three cards exclusively with Brew readers</strong>. We never could keep a secret, especially when it comes to credit cards with no annual fees and lots of other perks. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOPOLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/17/indian-government-shuts-off-internetagain?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Indian States Get the Permanent Spinny Wheel
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Protests in New Delhi, India " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2NjEzMjY5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Amal KS/ Hindustan Times via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last week, Indian officials <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/17/world/asia/india-internet-modi-protests.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shut down</a> internet access in three northeastern states and parts of West Bengal and Uttar Pradesh. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The shutdown came in response to </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/16/world/asia/india-citizenship-protests.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">protests currently raging</a></span><span> all over the country. Demonstrators are resisting a new law that provides a </span><span><a href="https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/12/india-anti-muslim-citizenship-bill-191209095557419.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fast-track to citizenship</a></span><span> for migrants from neighboring countries who practice all of South Asia’s major religions except Islam. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>They call the law discriminatory and dangerous to India’s 200 million Muslims. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> The country nixed internet service 134 times in 2018, making it easily the shutoff-happiest government in the world.  Critics say the internet blackouts have an air of authoritarianism for a country known as the world’s largest democracy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The government’s defense:</strong> no internet = no disinformation = diminished threat of violence. But some research <a href="https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=3330413&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">indicates</a> that shutting down the internet actually makes violence more likely. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory:</strong> The Indian government still hasn’t restored internet to Jammu and Kashmir, a Muslim-majority state it cut off in August. Protests there were responding to <a href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/article-370-to-be-scrapped-jk-will-ceases-to-be-a-state-2-union-territories-created/articleshow/70531899.cms?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the revocation</a> of Article 370 of the Indian Constitution, which denied the majority-Muslim state the right to function independently. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STARTUP
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/17/invest-ucommune?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Venture This: We’re Not Gonna Say It
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A vacuum covering up WeWork's mess" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1576619785.gif">

<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="A vacuum covering up WeWork's mess" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1576619785.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Welcome to Venture This. In this section, we'll tell you about a startup in the news, then ask: Would you invest? </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Except for cover bands, no one likes being compared to others. That's especially true for Ucommune, a leading Chinese coworking company that <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-wework-of-china-gears-up-for-a-new-york-ipo-11576584001?mod=hp_listb_pos3&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed to go public</a> in the U.S. last week. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But...it’s hard. WeWon’t mention its <span>doppelgänger by name</span>, but you know what WeMean. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some numbers, presented without comparison to any other coworking companies: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Ucommune had 171 spaces and 72,700 workstations on Sept. 30. They’re mostly in China, but it opened a single Manhattan outpost in 2018.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Ucommune’s </span><span><a href="https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/urwork#section-funding-rounds?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raised $704 million</a></span><span> from investors including venture capital giant Sequoia. It was last valued at $2.6 billion.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Ucommune’s losing money, mostly because new locations take a while to attract leases and turn a profit, it says. Ucommune had a net loss of $80 million on $122 million in revenue in the first nine months of the year. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Of note: We haven’t heard a peep about community adjusted EBITDA. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So...what do you think? Would U invest in Ucommune? <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1207059131271651333?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Let us know here</a>. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s been way too long since we’ve done Real Estate Appraiser, so let’s bring it back for ski season. Here’s a <a href="https://www.realtor.com/realestateandhomes-detail/36-Upper-Handle-Rd_Dover_VT_05356_M37047-44252?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">5-bed, 4.5-bath house</a> up in West Dover, VT, near Mount Snow.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1576604470.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt=""></p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">More details:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>4,182 square feet on a .75 acre lot</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Built in 1981</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Custom kitchen on the second level and a living room with a gas fireplace</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Has a full “Pub,” with a large bar and full-size antique billiards table</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Winter views of Mount Snow and Deerfield Valley</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So, amateur appraisers, what’s the listing price?</p>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eChristmas is exactly one week away.\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat you’re thinking: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“I should really start buying presents.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat FedEx is thinking:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e “Oh no, they’re going to start buying presents.” \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFedEx is very busy this time of year, but not too busy to report fiscal Q2 earnings that \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/17/fedex-fdx-earnings-q2-fy-2020.html?__source=twitter%7Cmain\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emissed expectations\u003c/a\u003e on both the top and bottom lines. Profit fell 40% and the company lowered its earnings guidance for the year...again. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo confront this “period of challenges and changes,” FedEx is going to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/fedex-warns-of-another-hit-to-profits-11576618506?mod=breakingnews\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erestrict hiring\u003c/a\u003e and shrink some of its air operations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThis holiday season has been tough for the industry\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn addition to battling slower economic growth, delivery companies have to deal with...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eA late Thanksgiving:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e This year has six fewer holiday shopping days than 2018, but you still have the same amount of relatives. Delivery companies must handle \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.retaildive.com/news/package-deal-what-holiday-delivery-can-tell-us-about-the-future-of-retail/568852/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ealmost double\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e their average package volume within a shorter timeframe. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBad weather: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWinter storms in the Upper Midwest, Rockies, and the Northeast \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wtol.com/article/news/local/holiday-delivery-deadlines/512-5c3bda91-f6e4-4bd9-8ad3-5ed9548270d1?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecaused delays\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, UPS said.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThen there’s Amazon\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Monday, Amazon said it was blocking its third-party sellers from using FedEx’s ground delivery service for Prime shipments, citing bad performance. FedEx will be in timeout “until the delivery performance of these ship methods improves,” an Amazon email \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/amazon-blocks-sellers-from-using-fedex-ground-for-prime-shipments-11576525190?mod=hp_lead_pos2\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereviewed by the WSJ\u003c/a\u003e said. \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFast facts: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn 2018, independent third-party sellers accounted for 58% of merchandise sales on Amazon—\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1018724/000119312519103013/d727605dex991.htm?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eup from 34%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in 2010.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFedEx downplayed the news, \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/amazon-blocks-sellers-from-using-fedex-ground-for-prime-shipments-2019-12-16-15103614?siteid=rss\u0026rss=1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaying\u003c/a\u003e “the overall impact to our business is minuscule.” Minuscule in impact, perhaps, but heavy in symbolism. In August, FedEx \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/08/07/fedex-to-end-ground-delivery-contract-with-amazon.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eended\u003c/a\u003e its ground delivery contract with Amazon as Bezos was expanding his own delivery empire. The two companies are now competing head-to-head in the logistics arena.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLast week, Morgan Stanley \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/12/analyst-amazon-delivering-nearly-half-its-packages-instead-of-ups-fedex.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eestimated\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that Amazon was already delivering roughly 50% of its own packages in the U.S.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd it’ll soon pass UPS and FedEx in total volume. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eFedEx shares fell nearly 7% after it reported earnings yesterday. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn the probably-more-relevant-to-you Democrats are hoping they can \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-16/deal-on-biodiesel-and-beer-credits-hinges-on-broader-tax-package?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enegotiate\u003c/a\u003e additional renewables tax breaks in exchange for tweaks related to building renovations in Trump's 2017 tax cuts. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe impact\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe \u003ca href=\"https://www.healthcaredive.com/news/aca-taxes-repealed-in-year-end-spending-bill-draft-surprise-billing-not-in/569239/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erepeal\u003c/a\u003e of three Obamacare taxes is expected to cut $373 billion from federal revenue through the 2020s. max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast week, Indian officials \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/17/world/asia/india-internet-modi-protests.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshut down\u003c/a\u003e internet access in three northeastern states and parts of West Bengal and Uttar Pradesh. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe shutdown came in response to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/16/world/asia/india-citizenship-protests.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprotests currently raging\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e all over the country. Demonstrators are resisting a new law that provides a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/12/india-anti-muslim-citizenship-bill-191209095557419.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efast-track to citizenship\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for migrants from neighboring countries who practice all of South Asia’s major religions except Islam. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThey call the law discriminatory and dangerous to India’s 200 million Muslims. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e The country nixed internet service 134 times in 2018, making it easily the shutoff-happiest government in the world.  Critics say the internet blackouts have an air of authoritarianism for a country known as the world’s largest democracy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe government’s defense:\u003c/strong\u003e no internet = no disinformation = diminished threat of violence. But some research \u003ca href=\"https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=3330413\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eindicates\u003c/a\u003e that shutting down the internet actually makes violence more likely. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory:\u003c/strong\u003e The Indian government still hasn’t restored internet to Jammu and Kashmir, a Muslim-majority state it cut off in August. Protests there were responding to \u003ca href=\"https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/article-370-to-be-scrapped-jk-will-ceases-to-be-a-state-2-union-territories-created/articleshow/70531899.cms?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe revocation\u003c/a\u003e of Article 370 of the Indian Constitution, which denied the majority-Muslim state the right to function independently. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" That's especially true for Ucommune, a leading Chinese coworking company that \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-wework-of-china-gears-up-for-a-new-york-ipo-11576584001?mod=hp_listb_pos3\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efiled to go public\u003c/a\u003e in the U.S. last week. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut...it’s hard. WeWon’t mention its \u003cspan\u003edoppelgänger by name\u003c/span\u003e, but you know what WeMean. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome numbers, presented without comparison to any other coworking companies: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUcommune had 171 spaces and 72,700 workstations on Sept. 30. They’re mostly in China, but it opened a single Manhattan outpost in 2018.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eUcommune’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/urwork#section-funding-rounds?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraised $704 million\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e from investors including venture capital giant Sequoia. It was last valued at $2.6 billion.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUcommune’s losing money, mostly because new locations take a while to attract leases and turn a profit, it says. Ucommune had a net loss of $80 million on $122 million in revenue in the first nine months of the year. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOf note: We haven’t heard a peep about community adjusted EBITDA. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo...what do you think?
